instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H_CPU: What is PPBUS_G3H_CPU? PPBUS_G3H_CPU is the .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Short.
threads.message: I have on the bench a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had cola spilled on it. the 2 areas that were hit were <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7220</CHIP>. both <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_CPU</SIGNAL> are 0.8 ohms to ground. Should I even bother injecting 1V, or should I kiss this one goodnight? I did replace <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C7651</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R7865</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7689</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7680</CAPACITOR> & <CAPACITOR>C7241</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Short.
threads.message: Again injecting into <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, whitout checking for short on CPU power supplies chips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Short.
threads.message: Did you read my post? I didnâ€™t say anything about the fact that I injected voltage. I measured for shorts...using resistance mode with the power off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Short.
threads.message:
I didn't afirm that.
Just saying why do you even THINK about voltage injection???
